Compute
\[\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ}.\]
inference:
We can use the identity $\frac{1}{\cos^2 x} = \sec^2 x = 1 + \tan^2 x,$ so
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= 1 + \tan^2 10^\circ + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= 1 + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}From the double angle formula, $\sin 20^\circ = 2 \sin 10^\circ \cos 10^\circ,$ so
\[\frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} = \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ}.\]Also, $\sin 40^\circ = 2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ,$ so
\[\frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} &= \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{4 \sin^4 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + \sin^2 10^\circ}{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + \sin^2 10^\circ &= \sin^2 10^\circ (64 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (\sin^2 20^\circ (64 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \cos^2 20^\circ) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ (16 \cos^2 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (2 \sin 20^\circ (16 \cos^2 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (32 \sin 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1).
\end{align*}Hence,
\[\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1)}{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} = \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.\]From the double angle formula,
\[16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ = 4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cdot 4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ = \sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ.\]Then
\[\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ}.\]From the triple angle formula,
\[\sin 60^\circ = 3 \sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^6 20^\circ.\]Since $\sin 60^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2},$
\[3 \sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^6 20^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}.\]Then $4 \sin^6 20^\circ = 3 \sin 20^\circ - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2},$ so
\[\sin^2 20^\circ = \frac{3 \sin 20^\circ - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ} = \frac{6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}}{8 \sin^2 20^\circ}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\frac{6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}}{8 \sin^2 20^\circ} \cdot \sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{8 (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1)}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8 &= 8 (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= 8 (2 \sin 20^\circ (8 \cos 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\
&= 8 (16 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= 8 (8 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= 64 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8.
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} &= \frac{64 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 (\sin 40^\circ + \sin 20^\circ) + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{128 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 \cos 10^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{8 (8 \cos 10^\circ + 1)}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
8 \cos 10^\circ + 1 &= 8 \cos 10^\circ + \cos 60^\circ \\
&= 2 (4 \cos 10^\circ + \cos 30^\circ) \\
&= 2 (4 \cos 10^\circ + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}) \\
&= 8 \cos 10^\circ + \sqrt{3}.
\end{align*}Then
\[\frac{8 (8 \cos 10^\circ + 1)}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} = \frac{8 (8 \cos 10^\circ + \sqrt{3})}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} = \frac{64 \cos 10^\circ + 8 \sqrt{3}}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ}.\]We can write

ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} &= \frac{2}{1 + \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 (1 - \cos 20^\circ)}{(1 + \cos 20^\circ)(1 - \cos 20^\circ)} \\
&= \frac{2 (1 - \cos 20^\circ)}{1 - \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ},
\end{align*}so
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{2 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{3 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 \cos^2 20^\circ (3 - 2 \cos 20^\circ)}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ}{\sin^2 40^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}By the triple angle formula,
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{2} &= \cos 60^\circ \\
&= \cos (3 \cdot 20^\circ) \\
&= 4 \cos^3 20^\circ - 3 \cos 20^\circ,
\end{align*}which means $8 \cos^3 20^\circ = 6 \cos 20^\circ + 1.$  Hence,
\begin{align*}
\frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 6 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 6 \cos 20^\circ}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 (1 - \cos^2 20^\circ) \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \cos 20^\circ - 4 \cos^3 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \cos 20^\circ - 3 \cos 20^\circ - \frac{1}{2}} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{\cos 20^\circ - \frac{1}{2}} \\
&= \boxed{12}.
\end{align*}

We can use the identity $\frac{1}{\cos^2 x} = \sec^2 x = 1 + \tan^2 x,$ so
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= 1 + \tan^2 10^\circ + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= 1 + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}From the double angle formula, $\sin 20^\circ = 2 \sin 10^\circ \cos 10^\circ,$ so
\[\frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} = \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ}.\]Also, $\sin 40^\circ = 2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ,$ so
\[\frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} &= \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{4 \sin^4 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 \sin^4 10^\circ + 1}{4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ}{16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + \sin^2 10^\circ}{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write
\begin{align*}
64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + \sin^2 10^\circ &= \sin^2 10^\circ (64 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (\sin^2 20^\circ (64 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 16 \cos^2 20^\circ) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ (16 \cos^2 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (2 \sin 20^\circ (16 \cos^2 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (32 \sin 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= \sin^2 10^\circ (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1).
\end{align*}Hence,
\[\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{\sin^2 10^\circ (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1)}{64 \sin^6 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} = \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ}.\]From the double angle formula,
\[16 \sin^4 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ = 4 \sin^2 10^\circ \cos^2 10^\circ \cdot 4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ = \sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ.\]Then
\[\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} = \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ}.\]From the triple angle formula,
\[\sin 60^\circ = 3 \sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^6 20^\circ.\]Since $\sin 60^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2},$
\[3 \sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^6 20^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}.\]Then $4 \sin^6 20^\circ = 3 \sin 20^\circ - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2},$ so
\[\sin^2 20^\circ = \frac{3 \sin 20^\circ - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ} = \frac{6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}}{8 \sin^2 20^\circ}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 20^\circ \sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1}{\frac{6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}}{8 \sin^2 20^\circ} \cdot \sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{8 (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1)}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write

128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8 &= 8 (16 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= 8 (2 \sin 20^\circ (8 \cos 20^\circ + 4) + 1) \\

&= 8 (8 \sin 40^\circ + 8 \sin 20^\circ + 1) \\
&= 64 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8.
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{128 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} &= \frac{64 \sin 40^\circ + 64 \sin 20^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 (\sin 40^\circ + \sin 20^\circ) + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{128 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{64 \cos 10^\circ + 8}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{8 (8 \cos 10^\circ + 1)}{(6 \sin 20^\circ - \sqrt{3}) \sin 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}We can write

ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} &= \frac{2}{1 + \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 (1 - \cos 20^\circ)}{(1 + \cos 20^\circ)(1 - \cos 20^\circ)} \\
&= \frac{2 (1 - \cos 20^\circ)}{1 - \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ},
\end{align*}so
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{\cos^2 10^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{2 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{3 - 2 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{4 \cos^2 20^\circ (3 - 2 \cos 20^\circ)}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ}{\sin^2 40^\circ} + \frac{1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}By the triple angle formula,
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{2} &= \cos 60^\circ \\
&= \cos (3 \cdot 20^\circ) \\
&= 4 \cos^3 20^\circ - 3 \cos 20^\circ,
\end{align*}which means $8 \cos^3 20^\circ = 6 \cos 20^\circ + 1.$  Hence,
\begin{align*}
\frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 8 \cos^3 20^\circ + 1}{\sin^2 40^\circ} &= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 6 \cos 20^\circ}{\sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos^2 20^\circ - 6 \cos 20^\circ}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 (1 - \cos^2 20^\circ) \cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \cos 20^\circ - 4 \cos^3 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{4 \cos 20^\circ - 3 \cos 20^\circ - \frac{1}{2}} \\
&= \frac{12 \cos 20^\circ - 6}{\cos 20^\circ - \frac{1}{2}} \\
&= \boxed{12}.
\end{align*}
